intro: Gonolobus lasiostomus, commonly known as the rough-stemmed morning glory, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions. It is characterized by its distinctive, coiled vines and showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that open in the morning. The plant has rough, hairy stems and heart-shaped leaves with a waxy texture. It belongs to the Convolvulaceae family, which includes many other morning glory species. Gonolobus lasiostomus is often found in disturbed soils and can thrive in a variety of environmental conditions.
